page.title: 12HACKFORD WALK
page.content: My walk begins in the centre of Hackford where there is a house called Firtree House because of the firtrees lining the edge of the garden. Then there is marsh. On the other side of the road there is a marshy field.Lots of animals live there like pheasants, peacocks and badgers. Some of the houses are new but most are old. There is a river about half a mile away from the marsh. There is a post box near the river. There are many grassy fields in Hackford. In Church Lane there is an old village hall that has been changed into a house. Next to this is a porch and two paths. One leads to St. Mary's church and the other to an old ,derelict house with ivy growing over it. A quarter of a mile away is an old pub,the King's Head,now a private house. The shop is also closed.
